articles.content:

Millions of people in the UK will soon be asked to track their movements to limit the spread of coronavirus.

articles.title: Gay and bisexual men excluded from coronavirus blood plasma trial - Metro.co.uk
articles.description: The trial rules are in line with current blood donation guidelines.
articles.content:
Men who have had sex with another man in the last three months are excluded from the trial (Picture: )
Gay and bisexual men have been told they cannot take part in a blood trial which experts hope could serve as a potential coronavirus treatment.
People who… [+3816 chars]

articles.title: Social distancing in Liverpool during Spanish flu pandemic of 1918 and how restrictions were lifted - Liverpool Echo
articles.description: The Spanish flu infected around 500 million people worldwide
articles.content:
Until recently, the prospect of social distancing and having to self-isolate in our own homes was unfamiliar to us all.

Results could be available as soon as September, the researchers say. The trial is not yet open to recruitment, but will be announced in due course.
